content.text:
# Draft:AI for Good Impact Awards

The AI for Good Impact Awards are an annual award co-organised by the International Telecommunications Union and the non-profit Tech to the Rescue since 2025. Awards are made under four categories. Submissions are solicited widely and judged by an independent panel, and presentations are made by the finalists and awards given to the winners at the ITU AI for Good Global Summit in Geneva, Switzerland.
Judging Panel
2025
{| class="wikitable"
|+ General Awards Panel
|-
! Name !! Role
|-
| Bilel Jamoussi || Deputy Director of TSB & Chief, Study Groups & Policy Department (SPD), International Telecommunication Union (ITU)
|-
| Lan Xue || Director of Institute for AI International Governance, Director of China Institute for Science and Technology Policy, and Co-Director of Global Institute for SDGs, Tsinghua University
|-
| Abby Daniell || Director - Worldwide Public Sector, Amazon Web Services (AWS)
|-
| Juan Lavista Ferres || Corporate Vice President & Chief Data Scientist, AI for Good Lab, Microsoft
|}
{| class="wikitable"
|+ Pro Bono Awards Panel
|-
! Name !! Role
|-
| Jacek Siadkowski || Co-Founder and CEO, Tech To The Rescue (TTTR)
|-
| Mary Jacques || Executive Director, Global ESG and Regulatory Compliance, Lenovo
|-
| Christopher Fabian || Co-Founder, Co-Lead - Giga, United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF)
|-
| Najwa Aaraj || CEO, Technology Innovation Institute (TII)
|}
Award Categories
The current award categories are:
* AI for People
* AI for Planet
* AI for Prosperity
* Pro Bono Collaboration
